newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: BOK intervenes again to slow won's fall - dealers.
newsitem.headline: BOK intervenes again to slow won's fall - dealers.

text.p: The central bank of Korea intervened in the interbank market in late afternoon trade for the second time on Wednesday to ease the won's decline against the U.S. dollar, dealers said.
The central bank denied it had intervened.
Dealers said the central bank stepped in again when the won fell to 819 against the dollar.
The won was trading at 818.70 near the market's close.
Market players said the BOK intervened in morning trade when the won hit a low of 820. Prior to the interventions, the won had fallen on short dollar covering and import settlements.
"The central bank seems set on keeping the dollar below 820," said a local trader.
